subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Pronunciation resource
msgSnippet: ... Good news!  The copy at Project Gutenberg is uncorrupted: http://www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext02/mpron10.zip -- MEET US AT POINT ORANGE AT MIDNIGHT BRING
messageBody:
John Cowan scripsit:

> Unfortunately, the Pronunciatior file unpacks improperly, and all the
> data is badly garbled. For example, the first word that isn't a name is
> "abacus", which is given the pronunciation "abakjylys" (in QS-SAMPA),
> something like "abaculous" in TO. And all the other words are equally
> useless: "crash" is pronounced as if it were "crashaclurbeler".

Good news! The copy at Project Gutenberg is uncorrupted:

http://www.gutenberg.org/dirs/etext02/mpron10.zip

--
MEET US AT POINT ORANGE AT MIDNIGHT BRING YOUR DUCK OR PREPARE TO FACE WUGGUMS
John Cowan cowan@... http://www.ccil.org/~cowan
